titles: A courtly new ballad of the princely wooing of the faire maid of London, by King Edward. To the tune of, Bonny sweet Robbin.
notes: Verse: "Faaire [sic] angell of England, thy beauty most bright ..."
In two parts; part 2 has caption title: The faire maid of Londons answer to King Edwards wanton love.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
